title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4208.1 - Purpose and general description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4208.1 - Purpose and general description

State Regulations

The purpose of this Part is to set forth the application
process, determine eligibility and codify administration by the corporation for
the Industrial Effectiveness Expansion, Retention and Attraction Assistance

Program to be funded from the Strategic Resurgence Fund authorized by the

Omnibus Economic Development Act of 1987, chapter 839 of the Laws of 1987. The
purposes of the program are to provide financial assistance to industrial firms
that will create or preserve substantial numbers of jobs, assist in the
expansion or retention of businesses located in New York State, assist in
attracting businesses to the State, fill gaps in financing from other private
and public sources, and enhance geographic areas of the State that are
currently substandard or insanitary, or are in danger of becoming substandard
or insanitary. The program will also seek to establish affirmative action goals
for participation in projects by minorities and women. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4208.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
